member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the AssociateCustomDomain operation. Associate your own domain name with the App Runner subdomain URL of your App Runner service.
After you call AssociateCustomDomain and receive a successful response, use the information in the CustomDomain record that's returned to add CNAME records to your Domain Name System (DNS). For each mapped domain name, add a mapping to the target App Runner subdomain and one or more certificate validation records. App Runner then performs DNS validation to verify that you own or control the domain name that you associated. App Runner tracks domain validity in a certificate stored in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainRequest.DomainName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainName.
A custom domain endpoint to associate. Specify a root domain (for example, example.com), a subdomain (for example, login.example.com or admin.login.example.com), or a wildcard (for example, *.example.com).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainRequest.EnableWWWSubdomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableWWWSubdomain.
Set to true to associate the subdomain www.DomainName with the App Runner service in addition to the base domain.
Default: true

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainRequest.ServiceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the App Runner service that you want to associate a custom domain name with.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AssociateCustomDomain operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainResponse.CustomDomain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomDomain.
A description of the domain name that's being associated.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainResponse.DNSTarget
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DNSTarget.
The App Runner subdomain of the App Runner service. The custom domain name is mapped to this target name.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainResponse.ServiceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the App Runner service with which a custom domain name is associated.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AuthenticationConfiguration

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AuthenticationConfiguration.AccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants the App Runner service access to a source repository. It's required for ECR image repositories (but not for ECR Public repositories).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AuthenticationConfiguration.ConnectionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the App Runner connection that enables the App Runner service to connect to a source repository. It's required for GitHub code repositories.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration
member.summary:
Describes an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource. Multiple revisions of a configuration have the same AutoScalingConfigurationName and different AutoScalingConfigurationRevision values.
A higher MinSize increases the spread of your App Runner service over more Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region. The tradeoff is a higher minimal cost.
A lower MaxSize controls your cost. The tradeoff is lower responsiveness during peak demand.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.AutoScalingConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this auto scaling configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.AutoScalingConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationName.
The customer-provided auto scaling configuration name. It can be used in multiple revisions of a configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.AutoScalingConfigurationRevision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationRevision.
The revision of this auto scaling configuration. It's unique among all the active configurations ("Status": "ACTIVE") that share the same AutoScalingConfigurationName.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The time when the auto scaling configuration was created. It's in Unix time stamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.DeletedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletedAt.
The time when the auto scaling configuration was deleted. It's in Unix time stamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.Latest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Latest.
It's set to true for the configuration with the highest Revision among all configurations that share the same Name. It's set to false otherwise.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.MaxConcurrency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxConcurrency.
The maximum number of concurrent requests that an instance processes. If the number of concurrent requests exceeds this limit, App Runner scales the service up.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.MaxSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxSize.
The maximum number of instances that a service scales up to. At most MaxSize instances actively serve traffic for your service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.MinSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinSize.
The minimum number of instances that App Runner provisions for a service. The service always has at least MinSize provisioned instances. Some of them actively serve traffic. The rest of them (provisioned and inactive instances) are a cost-effective compute capacity reserve and are ready to be quickly activated. You pay for memory usage of all the provisioned instances. You pay for CPU usage of only the active subset.
App Runner temporarily doubles the number of provisioned instances during deployments, to maintain the same capacity for both old and new code.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfiguration.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current state of the auto scaling configuration. If the status of a configuration revision is INACTIVE, it was deleted and can't be used. Inactive configuration revisions are permanently removed some time after they are deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfigurationSummary
member.summary:
Provides summary information about an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource.
This type contains limited information about an auto scaling configuration. It includes only identification information, without configuration details. It's returned by the ListAutoScalingConfigurations action. Complete configuration information is returned by the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration, DescribeAutoScalingConfiguration, and DeleteAutoScalingConfiguration actions using the AutoScalingConfiguration type.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfigurationSummary.AutoScalingConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this auto scaling configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfigurationSummary.AutoScalingConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationName.
The customer-provided auto scaling configuration name. It can be used in multiple revisions of a configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AutoScalingConfigurationSummary.AutoScalingConfigurationRevision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationRevision.
The revision of this auto scaling configuration. It's unique among all the active configurations ("Status": "ACTIVE") with the same AutoScalingConfigurationName.

member.summary:

The basic configuration for building and running the App Runner service. Use it to quickly launch an App Runner service without providing a apprunner.yaml file in the source code repository (or ignoring the file if it exists).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CodeConfiguration.ConfigurationSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConfigurationSource.
The source of the App Runner configuration. Values are interpreted as follows:

API – App Runner uses configuration values provided in CodeConfigurationValues and ignores the apprunner.yaml file in the source code repository.

member.summary: Describes the basic configuration needed for building and running an App Runner service. This type doesn't support the full set of possible configuration options. Fur full configuration capabilities, use a apprunner.yaml file in the source code repository.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration operation. Create an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource. App Runner requires this resource when you create App Runner services that require non-default auto scaling settings. You can share an auto scaling configuration across multiple services.
Create multiple revisions of a configuration by using the same AutoScalingConfigurationName and different AutoScalingConfigurationRevision values. When you create a service, you can set it to use the latest active revision of an auto scaling configuration or a specific revision.
Configure a higher MinSize to increase the spread of your App Runner service over more Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region. The tradeoff is a higher minimal cost.
Configure a lower MaxSize to control your cost. The tradeoff is lower responsiveness during peak demand.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest.AutoScalingConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationName.
A name for the auto scaling configuration. When you use it for the first time in an Amazon Web Services Region, App Runner creates revision number 1 of this name. When you use the same name in subsequent calls, App Runner creates incremental revisions of the configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest.MaxConcurrency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxConcurrency.
The maximum number of concurrent requests that you want an instance to process. If the number of concurrent requests exceeds this limit, App Runner scales up your service.
Default: 100

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest.MaxSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxSize.
The maximum number of instances that your service scales up to. At most MaxSize instances actively serve traffic for your service.
Default: 25

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest.MinSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinSize.
The minimum number of instances that App Runner provisions for your service. The service always has at least MinSize provisioned instances. Some of them actively serve traffic. The rest of them (provisioned and inactive instances) are a cost-effective compute capacity reserve and are ready to be quickly activated. You pay for memory usage of all the provisioned instances. You pay for CPU usage of only the active subset.
App Runner temporarily doubles the number of provisioned instances during deployments, to maintain the same capacity for both old and new code.
Default: 1

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of metadata items that you can associate with your auto scaling configuration resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationResponse.AutoScalingConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfiguration.
A description of the App Runner auto scaling configuration that's created by this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateConnection operation. Create an App Runner connection resource. App Runner requires a connection resource when you create App Runner services that access private repositories from certain third-party providers. You can share a connection across multiple services.
A connection resource is needed to access GitHub repositories. GitHub requires a user interface approval process through the App Runner console before you can use the connection.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.ConnectionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ConnectionName.
A name for the new connection. It must be unique across all App Runner connections for the Amazon Web Services account in the Amazon Web Services Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.ProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ProviderType.
The source repository provider.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A list of metadata items that you can associate with your connection resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateConnection operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionResponse.Connection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Connection.
A description of the App Runner connection that's created by this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateService operation. Create an App Runner service. After the service is created, the action also automatically starts a deployment.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.AutoScalingConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource that you want to associate with your service. If not provided, App Runner associates the latest revision of a default auto scaling configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionConfiguration.
An optional custom encryption key that App Runner uses to encrypt the copy of your source repository that it maintains and your service logs. By default, App Runner uses an Amazon Web Services managed CMK.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.HealthCheckConfiguration
member.summary:

The settings for the health check that App Runner performs to monitor the health of your service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.InstanceConfiguration
member.summary:

The runtime configuration of instances (scaling units) of the App Runner service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.ServiceName
member.summary:

A name for the new service. It must be unique across all the running App Runner services in your Amazon Web Services account in the Amazon Web Services Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.SourceConfiguration
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateServiceRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An optional list of metadata items that you can associate with your service resource. A tag is a key-value pair.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteAutoScalingConfiguration operation. Delete an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource. You can delete a specific revision or the latest active revision. You can't delete a configuration that's used by one or more App Runner services.

The ARN can be a full auto scaling configuration ARN, or a partial ARN ending with either .../name or .../name/revision . If a revision isn't specified, the latest active revision is deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.DisassociateCustomDomainRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DisassociateCustomDomain operation. Disassociate a custom domain name from an App Runner service.
Certificates tracking domain validity are associated with a custom domain and are stored in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM). These certificates aren't deleted as part of this action. App Runner delays certificate deletion for 30 days after a domain is disassociated from your service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.DisassociateCustomDomainRequest.DomainName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainName.
The domain name that you want to disassociate from the App Runner service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.DisassociateCustomDomainRequest.ServiceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the App Runner service that you want to disassociate a custom domain name from.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.DisassociateCustomDomainResponse.DNSTarget
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.DisassociateCustomDomainResponse.ServiceArn

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary: Describes a custom encryption key that App Runner uses to encrypt copies of the source repository and service logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.EncryptionConfiguration.KmsKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKey.
The ARN of the KMS key that's used for encryption.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration
member.summary: Describes the settings for the health check that App Runner performs to monitor the health of a service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration.HealthyThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HealthyThreshold.
The number of consecutive checks that must succeed before App Runner decides that the service is healthy.
Default: 1

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration.Interval
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Interval.
The time interval, in seconds, between health checks.
Default: 5

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration.Path
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Path.
The URL that health check requests are sent to.
Path is only applicable when you set Protocol to HTTP.
Default: "/"

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration.Protocol
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Protocol.
The IP protocol that App Runner uses to perform health checks for your service.
If you set Protocol to HTTP, App Runner sends health check requests to the HTTP path specified by Path.
Default: TCP

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration.Timeout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Timeout.
The time, in seconds, to wait for a health check response before deciding it failed.
Default: 2

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.HealthCheckConfiguration.UnhealthyThreshold
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnhealthyThreshold.
The number of consecutive checks that must fail before App Runner decides that the service is unhealthy.
Default: 5

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageConfiguration
member.summary: Describes the configuration that App Runner uses to run an App Runner service using an image pulled from a source image repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageConfiguration.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port that your application listens to in the container.
Default: 8080

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageConfiguration.RuntimeEnvironmentVariables
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuntimeEnvironmentVariables.
Environment variables that are available to your running App Runner service. An array of key-value pairs. Keys with a prefix of AWSAPPRUNNER are reserved for system use and aren't valid.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageConfiguration.StartCommand
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartCommand.
An optional command that App Runner runs to start the application in the source image. If specified, this command overrides the Docker image’s default start command.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageRepository
member.summary: Describes a source image repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageRepository.ImageConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageConfiguration.
Configuration for running the identified image.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageRepository.ImageIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageIdentifier.
The identifier of an image.
For an image in Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR), this is an image name. For the image name format, see Pulling an image in the Amazon ECR User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ImageRepository.ImageRepositoryType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageRepositoryType.
The type of the image repository. This reflects the repository provider and whether the repository is private or public.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.InstanceConfiguration
member.summary: Describes the runtime configuration of an App Runner service instance (scaling unit).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.InstanceConfiguration.Cpu
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Cpu.
The number of CPU units reserved for each instance of your App Runner service.
Default: 1 vCPU

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.InstanceConfiguration.InstanceRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that provides permissions to your App Runner service. These are permissions that your code needs when it calls any Amazon Web Services APIs.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.InstanceConfiguration.Memory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Memory.
The amount of memory, in MB or GB, reserved for each instance of your App Runner service.
Default: 2 GB

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ListAutoScalingConfigurationsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListAutoScalingConfigurations operation. Returns a list of App Runner automatic scaling configurations in your Amazon Web Services account. You can query the revisions for a specific configuration name or the revisions for all configurations in your account. You can optionally query only the latest revision of each requested name.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ListAutoScalingConfigurationsRequest.AutoScalingConfigurationName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationName.
The name of the App Runner auto scaling configuration that you want to list. If specified, App Runner lists revisions that share this name. If not specified, App Runner returns revisions of all configurations.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ListAutoScalingConfigurationsRequest.LatestOnly
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LatestOnly.
Set to true to list only the latest revision for each requested configuration name.
Keep as false to list all revisions for each requested configuration name.
Default: false

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ListAutoScalingConfigurationsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to include in each response (result page). It's used for a paginated request.
If you don't specify MaxResults, the request retrieves all available results in a single response.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.ListAutoScalingConfigurationsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A token from a previous result page. It's used for a paginated request. The request retrieves the next result page. All other parameter values must be identical to the ones that are specified in the initial request.
If you don't specify NextToken, the request retrieves the first result page.

member.summary:

A list of summary information records for auto scaling configurations. In a paginated request, the request returns up to MaxResults records for each call.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.PauseServiceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the PauseService operation. Pause an active App Runner service. App Runner reduces compute capacity for the service to zero and loses state (for example, ephemeral storage is removed).
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.summary:

member.summary:

The unique ID of the asynchronous operation that this request started. You can use it combined with the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.PauseServiceResponse.Service
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Service.
A description of the App Runner service that this request just paused.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service
member.summary:
Describes an App Runner service. It can describe a service in any state, including deleted services.
This type contains the full information about a service, including configuration details. It's returned by the CreateService, DescribeService, and DeleteService actions. A subset of this information is returned by the ListServices action using the ServiceSummary type.

The time when the App Runner service was created. It's in the Unix time stamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.DeletedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletedAt.
The time when the App Runner service was deleted. It's in the Unix time stamp format.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionConfiguration.
The encryption key that App Runner uses to encrypt the service logs and the copy of the source repository that App Runner maintains for the service. It can be either a customer-provided encryption key or an Amazon Web Services managed CMK.

The runtime configuration of instances (scaling units) of this service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.ServiceArn
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.ServiceId

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.ServiceName

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.ServiceUrl
member.summary:

A subdomain URL that App Runner generated for this service. You can use this URL to access your service web application.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.SourceConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceConfiguration.
The source deployed to the App Runner service. It can be a code or an image repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current state of the App Runner service. These particular values mean the following.
CREATE_FAILED – The service failed to create. To troubleshoot this failure, read the failure events and logs, change any parameters that need to be fixed, and retry the call to create the service.
The failed service isn't usable, and still counts towards your service quota. When you're done analyzing the failure, delete the service.
DELETE_FAILED – The service failed to delete and can't be successfully recovered. Retry the service deletion call to ensure that all related resources are removed.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.Service.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The time when the App Runner service was last updated at. It's in the Unix time stamp format.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceCodeVersion
member.summary: Identifies a version of code that App Runner refers to within a source code repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceCodeVersion.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of version identifier.
For a git-based repository, branches represent versions.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceCodeVersion.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
A source code version.
For a git-based repository, a branch name maps to a specific version. App Runner uses the most recent commit to the branch.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceConfiguration
member.summary: Describes the source deployed to an App Runner service. It can be a code or an image repository.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceConfiguration.AuthenticationConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationConfiguration.
Describes the resources that are needed to authenticate access to some source repositories.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceConfiguration.AutoDeploymentsEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoDeploymentsEnabled.
If true, continuous integration from the source repository is enabled for the App Runner service. Each repository change (including any source code commit or new image version) starts a deployment.
Default: App Runner sets to false for a source image that uses an ECR Public repository or an ECR repository that's in an Amazon Web Services account other than the one that the service is in. App Runner sets to true in all other cases (which currently include a source code repository or a source image using a same-account ECR repository).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceConfiguration.CodeRepository
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CodeRepository.
The description of a source code repository.
You must provide either this member or ImageRepository (but not both).

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.SourceConfiguration.ImageRepository
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImageRepository.
The description of a source image repository.
You must provide either this member or CodeRepository (but not both).

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.StartDeploymentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartDeployment operation. Initiate a manual deployment of the latest commit in a source code repository or the latest image in a source image repository to an App Runner service.
For a source code repository, App Runner retrieves the commit and builds a Docker image. For a source image repository, App Runner retrieves the latest Docker image. In both cases, App Runner then deploys the new image to your service and starts a new container instance.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.StartDeploymentRequest.ServiceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the App Runner service that you want to manually deploy to.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.StartDeploymentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartDeployment operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.StartDeploymentResponse.OperationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OperationId.
The unique ID of the asynchronous operation that this request started. You can use it combined with the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateService operation. Update an App Runner service. You can update the source configuration and instance configuration of the service. You can also update the ARN of the auto scaling configuration resource that's associated with the service. However, you can't change the name or the encryption configuration of the service. These can be set only when you create the service.
To update the tags applied to your service, use the separate actions TagResource and UntagResource.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest.AutoScalingConfigurationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AutoScalingConfigurationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource that you want to associate with your service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest.HealthCheckConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HealthCheckConfiguration.
The settings for the health check that App Runner performs to monitor the health of your service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest.InstanceConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InstanceConfiguration.
The runtime configuration to apply to instances (scaling units) of the App Runner service.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest.ServiceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServiceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the App Runner service that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest.SourceConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceConfiguration.
The source configuration to apply to the App Runner service.
You can change the configuration of the code or image repository that the service uses. However, you can't switch from code to image or the other way around. This means that you must provide the same structure member of SourceConfiguration that you originally included when you created the service. Specifically, you can include either CodeRepository or ImageRepository. To update the source configuration, set the values to members of the structure that you include.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateService operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceResponse.OperationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OperationId.
The unique ID of the asynchronous operation that this request started. You can use it combined with the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceResponse.Service
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Service.
A description of the App Runner service updated by this request. All configuration values in the returned Service structure reflect configuration changes that are being applied by this request.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.AmazonAppRunnerClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing AppRunner
App Runner
App Runner is an application service that provides a fast, simple, and cost-effective way to go directly from an existing container image or source code to a running service in the Amazon Web Services Cloud in seconds. You don't need to learn new technologies, decide which compute service to use, or understand how to provision and configure Amazon Web Services resources.
App Runner connects directly to your container registry or source code repository. It provides an automatic delivery pipeline with fully managed operations, high performance, scalability, and security.
For more information about App Runner, see the App Runner Developer Guide. For release information, see the App Runner Release Notes.
To install the Software Development Kits (SDKs), Integrated Development Environment (IDE) Toolkits, and command line tools that you can use to access the API, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.
Endpoints
For a list of Region-specific endpoints that App Runner supports, see App Runner endpoints and quotas in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

member.summary:
Constructs AmazonAppRunnerClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.AmazonAppRunnerClient.AssociateCustomDomain(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainRequest)
member.summary:
Associate your own domain name with the App Runner subdomain URL of your App Runner service.
After you call AssociateCustomDomain and receive a successful response, use the information in the CustomDomain record that's returned to add CNAME records to your Domain Name System (DNS). For each mapped domain name, add a mapping to the target App Runner subdomain and one or more certificate validation records. App Runner then performs DNS validation to verify that you own or control the domain name that you associated. App Runner tracks domain validity in a certificate stored in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AssociateCustomDomain service method.
member.returns: The response from the AssociateCustomDomain service method, as returned by AppRunner.
member.exception: An unexpected service exception occurred.
One or more input parameters aren't valid. Refer to the API action's document page, correct the input parameters, and try the action again.
You can't perform this action when the resource is in its current state.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for AssociateCustomDomain Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.AmazonAppRunnerClient.CreateAutoScalingConfiguration(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest)
member.summary:
Create an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource. App Runner requires this resource when you create App Runner services that require non-default auto scaling settings. You can share an auto scaling configuration across multiple services.
Create multiple revisions of a configuration by using the same AutoScalingConfigurationName and different AutoScalingConfigurationRevision values. When you create a service, you can set it to use the latest active revision of an auto scaling configuration or a specific revision.
Configure a higher MinSize to increase the spread of your App Runner service over more Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region. The tradeoff is a higher minimal cost.
Configure a lower MaxSize to control your cost. The tradeoff is lower responsiveness during peak demand.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration service method, as returned by AppRunner.
member.exception: An unexpected service exception occurred.
One or more input parameters aren't valid. Refer to the API action's document page, correct the input parameters, and try the action again.

App Runner can't create this resource. You've reached your account quota for this resource type.
For App Runner per-resource quotas, see App Runner endpoints and quotas in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateAutoScalingConfiguration Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.AmazonAppRunnerClient.CreateConnection(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateConnectionRequest)
member.summary:
Create an App Runner connection resource. App Runner requires a connection resource when you create App Runner services that access private repositories from certain third-party providers. You can share a connection across multiple services.
A connection resource is needed to access GitHub repositories. GitHub requires a user interface approval process through the App Runner console before you can use the connection.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.AmazonAppRunnerClient.StartDeployment(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.StartDeploymentRequest)
member.summary:
Initiate a manual deployment of the latest commit in a source code repository or the latest image in a source image repository to an App Runner service.
For a source code repository, App Runner retrieves the commit and builds a Docker image. For a source image repository, App Runner retrieves the latest Docker image. In both cases, App Runner then deploys the new image to your service and starts a new container instance.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.AmazonAppRunnerClient.UpdateService(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest)
member.summary:
Update an App Runner service. You can update the source configuration and instance configuration of the service. You can also update the ARN of the auto scaling configuration resource that's associated with the service. However, you can't change the name or the encryption configuration of the service. These can be set only when you create the service.
To update the tags applied to your service, use the separate actions TagResource and UntagResource.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: T:Amazon.AppRunner.IAmazonAppRunner
member.summary:
Interface for accessing AppRunner
App Runner
App Runner is an application service that provides a fast, simple, and cost-effective way to go directly from an existing container image or source code to a running service in the Amazon Web Services Cloud in seconds. You don't need to learn new technologies, decide which compute service to use, or understand how to provision and configure Amazon Web Services resources.
App Runner connects directly to your container registry or source code repository. It provides an automatic delivery pipeline with fully managed operations, high performance, scalability, and security.
For more information about App Runner, see the App Runner Developer Guide. For release information, see the App Runner Release Notes.
To install the Software Development Kits (SDKs), Integrated Development Environment (IDE) Toolkits, and command line tools that you can use to access the API, see Tools for Amazon Web Services.
Endpoints
For a list of Region-specific endpoints that App Runner supports, see App Runner endpoints and quotas in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.AppRunner.IAmazonAppRunner.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.IAmazonAppRunner.AssociateCustomDomain(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.AssociateCustomDomainRequest)
member.summary:
Associate your own domain name with the App Runner subdomain URL of your App Runner service.
After you call AssociateCustomDomain and receive a successful response, use the information in the CustomDomain record that's returned to add CNAME records to your Domain Name System (DNS). For each mapped domain name, add a mapping to the target App Runner subdomain and one or more certificate validation records. App Runner then performs DNS validation to verify that you own or control the domain name that you associated. App Runner tracks domain validity in a certificate stored in AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the AssociateCustomDomain service method.
member.returns: The response from the AssociateCustomDomain service method, as returned by AppRunner.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.IAmazonAppRunner.CreateAutoScalingConfiguration(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.CreateAutoScalingConfigurationRequest)
member.summary:
Create an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource. App Runner requires this resource when you create App Runner services that require non-default auto scaling settings. You can share an auto scaling configuration across multiple services.
Create multiple revisions of a configuration by using the same AutoScalingConfigurationName and different AutoScalingConfigurationRevision values. When you create a service, you can set it to use the latest active revision of an auto scaling configuration or a specific revision.
Configure a higher MinSize to increase the spread of your App Runner service over more Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region. The tradeoff is a higher minimal cost.
Configure a lower MaxSize to control your cost. The tradeoff is lower responsiveness during peak demand.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateAutoScalingConfiguration service method, as returned by AppRunner.
member.exception: An unexpected service exception occurred.
One or more input parameters aren't valid. Refer to the API action's document page, correct the input parameters, and try the action again.

App Runner can't create this resource. You've reached your account quota for this resource type.
For App Runner per-resource quotas, see App Runner endpoints and quotas in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateAutoScalingConfiguration Operation

member.summary:
Create an App Runner automatic scaling configuration resource. App Runner requires this resource when you create App Runner services that require non-default auto scaling settings. You can share an auto scaling configuration across multiple services.
Create multiple revisions of a configuration by using the same AutoScalingConfigurationName and different AutoScalingConfigurationRevision values. When you create a service, you can set it to use the latest active revision of an auto scaling configuration or a specific revision.
Configure a higher MinSize to increase the spread of your App Runner service over more Availability Zones in the Amazon Web Services Region. The tradeoff is a higher minimal cost.
Configure a lower MaxSize to control your cost. The tradeoff is lower responsiveness during peak demand.

A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.IAmazonAppRunner.StartDeployment(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.StartDeploymentRequest)
member.summary:
Initiate a manual deployment of the latest commit in a source code repository or the latest image in a source image repository to an App Runner service.
For a source code repository, App Runner retrieves the commit and builds a Docker image. For a source image repository, App Runner retrieves the latest Docker image. In both cases, App Runner then deploys the new image to your service and starts a new container instance.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.

member.name: M:Amazon.AppRunner.IAmazonAppRunner.UpdateService(Amazon.AppRunner.Model.UpdateServiceRequest)
member.summary:
Update an App Runner service. You can update the source configuration and instance configuration of the service. You can also update the ARN of the auto scaling configuration resource that's associated with the service. However, you can't change the name or the encryption configuration of the service. These can be set only when you create the service.
To update the tags applied to your service, use the separate actions TagResource and UntagResource.
This is an asynchronous operation. On a successful call, you can use the returned OperationId and the ListOperations call to track the operation's progress.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateService service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateService service method, as returned by AppRunner.
